intro: Sonerila cavaleriei, commonly known as the Cavalerie's waxplant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, waxy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
